intro: Microchilus commelinoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and swamps. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers that are often green or brown in color. It has a fibrous root system and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Microchilus commelinoides plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
